item.title: Inline Variables in C++17
item.description: I watched Nir Friedman’s cppcon talk on globals and the linker. This post is a hands-on to try inline variables in C++. What are inline variables? cppreference on inline specifier says An inline function or variable (since C++17) with external linkage (e.g. not declared static) has the following additional properties: There may be more than one definition of an inline function or variable (since C++17) in the program as long as each definition appears in a different translation unit and (for non-static inline functions and variables (since C++17)) all definitions are identical.
